alert.note: Alert for Uintah (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 25 at 1:44PM MDT until May 28 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Utah... Green River near Jensen affecting Uintah County. .Warm temperatures will continue to melt snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Green River near Jensen. * WHEN...Until Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 9.5 feet, minor lowland flooding is expected along the Green River, impacting agricultural land, irrigation and a few out buildings near the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:30 PM MDT Thursday the stage was 9.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate near bankfull conditions this weekend, then is expected to exceed banks early next week with a maximum value of 9.6 feet by Monday morning. - Action stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood stage is 10.8 feet. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
